reviewText: This film is very well written, directed, and the acting is great. A wonderful cast. Michael J. Fox gives a great performance. "Greedy" explores just how low people will stoop where there is money involved. Especially if they think they have a chance to get some of it. Watch as these characters stab each other in the back, while at the same time teaming up to get the fortune from their uncle, any way they have to. The effects of greed in people lives can make for very unusual behavior. Michael Douglas is awesome and apparently enjoyed this role very much. A movie you will want to see again and again. It's in my collection and I intend to keep it. I highly recommend it. Prepare to laugh.
summary: How low would you stoop to inherit a fortune?

reviewText: Last night's bargain-rack DVD was "Greedy" starring Michael. J Fox and Kirk Douglas. It was one of the better Fox movies I've seen recently. It was a comedy that was naturally somewhat ironic and humorous and the actors didn't have to try so hard to be funny. It poked a lot of fun at people in general and their tendency toward greedy ways and we probably could all see ourselves in it. Douglas was cast as an aging extended family member having considerable wealth and all the other actors were subordinate family members waiting for him to croak so that they could inherit their share (as large as they could get it) of his wealthy empire. Well, the old goat (Kirk Douglas) was a sly and controlling manipulator who had them all dangling on strings. It was funny and graphically brought out the greed we all (well, most of us) have within us. I particularly found all the backstabbing to get to the top position was amusing. Fox, was one of the minor relatives and one who was disinclined to participate, but even he got caught up in the greed. It all came to an amusing and surprising ending.The movie was fairly well done. The photography and sound were good, as was the setting. The movie had a good pace and boredom never set it. It was good to see Kirk Douglas again after many years absence, at least for me. The other acting was, well, hit and miss. Some of the parts were overacted in the extreme, but I guess this was part of being a comedy and trying so hard to be funny. Personally, I think better direction could have been exercised. All in all, it was a fairly good and fairly amusing movie.Gary Peterson
summary: A Fairly Good and Fairly Amusing Movie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If your great uncle Joe is a filthy rich yet stubborn millionaire with a good chance of keeling over, would you brown nose and back stab to get a shot at his inheritance?  Director Jonathan Lynn toys with this very idea througout this extremely funny film with hilarious results and surprise after surprise.It's uncle Joe's 75th birthday, and his rotten relatives fight each other to earn the slightest ounce of respect from him.  But Uncle Joe surprises them all with the arrival of a sexy young English nurse.  Highly suspicious of this woman's intentions, the relatives enlist the help of their cousin Danny (Michael J. Fox) who had always been in Uncle Joe's good favor over the years.  While secretly jealous of Danny, they realize he's their only hope in keeping the family fortune within the family.  Danny reluctantly agrees to help his greedy cousins only if it benefits Uncle Joe's welfare.  But slowly, he too becomes tempted by wealth, and like the rest, falls prey to Uncle Joe's crafty game of manipulation.  In the end, who will rise above the rest in Uncle Joe's complex test?Absolutley hilarious with many laugh out loud moments.  You don't want to miss it.

reviewText: From two great writers who worked on "Happy Days," it is safe to say that this film is one of the greatest comedies of the decade.  It is a tad predictable, but beyond that it has a lively script and well cast performers. Great players gave great performances.  This is clearly a comedy which also hit the right dramatic notes.  Parts of the movie are emotional and believable.  Any Mike J. Fox or Phil Hartman fan should see this.  Kirk Douglas was a hoot.  Nancy Travis as the lead actress was dead on.  Her character was full of wit and charm, despite a bad hair day.  Watch for strong performances by all.
summary: One of the BEST comedies to rent or own!!

reviewText: How far would you go to see how far your relatives would go if you were rich & they thought you were dying??....this is the basic plot to this film & it is so funny because all of us have relatives like these, most of us probably have at least one rich relative that everyone is jealous of or can't wait to die, Kirk Douglas is a hoot as Uncle Joe who it seems takes delight in watching his relatives not only suck up to him, but also try to one up each other to win his favor, the late Phil Hartman is a blast as the worst of the bunch who along with the rest gets quite upset when Uncle Joe introduces his new live-in younger girlfriend, Olivia D'Abo (Conan The Destroyer) who is eye candy no doubt, thinking that she might get the inheritance, they bring Danny (Michael J. Fox) into their twisted scheme, it seems that Danny has his own life with his girlfried (Nancy Travis) & doesn't really want to be a part of this scheme, but him & Uncle Joe have always been close & he too begins to get tempted by sudden wealth, suddenly it becomes a battle of will as everyone gets greedy with Uncle Joe just watching & wondering who really cares about him, Abo & Fox's verbal confrontation is funny & Hartman never lets up as the instigator of the bunch, him threatning Abo that people have accidents is funny because you know he is nutty enough to do it, or his & Fox's fight toward the end, I think we all know someone like Hartman's character, Hartman takes this character & just has a field day here & the surprising twist at the very end is funny but manipulating, I think the reason this one didn't do better was beacuse too many people might have been reminded of themselves, the things people will do for an inheritance is quite too real & this one is one good cautionary tale about the joys & pains that wealth can bring to anyone who is rich.
Title: N/A
